lead_paragraph: Ángel Cabrera, the United States Open champion, overcame an atrocious start with a spectacular finish to win the PGA Grand Slam of Golf, outlasting Padraig Harrington in a playoff. Cabrera recovered from a triple bogey on the opening hole that put him five shots behind with a birdie-eagle finish. He finished with a two-under-par 68 to get into a playoff with Harrington, the British Open champion, at Mid-Ocean Club in Tucker’s Town, Bermuda. Cabrera won on the third extra hole.
